verses.verse: Ephraim <WH669> feedeth<WH7462> on wind,<WH7307> and followeth after<WH7291> the east wind:<WH6921> he daily<WH3605> <WH3117> increaseth<WH7235> lies<WH3577> and desolation;<WH7701> and they do make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with<WH5973> the Assyrians,<WH804> and oil<WH8081> is carried<WH2986> into Egypt.<WH4714>

The LORD<WH3068> hath also a controversy<WH7379> with<WH5973> Judah,<WH3063> and will punish<WH6485> <WH5921> Jacob<WH3290> according to his ways;<WH1870> according to his doings<WH4611> will he recompense<WH7725> him.
He took his brother by the heel<WH6117> <WH853> <WH251> in the womb,<WH990> and by his strength<WH202> he had power<WH8280> with<WH854> God: <WH430>

Yea, he had power<WH8280> over<WH413> the angel,<WH4397> and prevailed:<WH3201> he wept,<WH1058> and made supplication<WH2603> unto him: he found<WH4672> him in Bethel,<WH1008> and there<WH8033> he spoke<WH1696> with<WH5973> us;
Even the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts;<WH6635> the LORD<WH3068> is his memorial.<WH2143>
Therefore turn<WH7725> thou<WH859> to thy God:<WH430> keep<WH8104> mercy<WH2617> and judgment,<WH4941> and wait<WH6960> on<WH413> thy God<WH430> continually.<WH8548>
He is a merchant,<WH3667> the balances<WH3976> of deceit<WH4820> are in his hand:<WH3027> he loveth<WH157> to oppress.<WH6231>

And Ephraim<WH669> said,<WH559> Yet<WH389> I am become rich,<WH6238> I have found me out<WH4672> substance:<WH202> in all<WH3605> my labors<WH3018> they shall find<WH4672> none<WH3808> iniquity<WH5771> in me that<WH834> were sin.<WH2399>

And I<WH595> that am the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> from the land<WH4480> <WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> will yet<WH5750> make thee to dwell<WH3427> in tabernacles,<WH168> as in the days<WH3117> of the solemn feast.<WH4150>
I have also spoken<WH1696> by<WH5921> the prophets,<WH5030> and I<WH595> have multiplied<WH7235> visions,<WH2377> and used similitudes,<WH1819> by the ministry<WH3027> of the prophets.<WH5030>

Is there iniquity<WH205> in Gilead?<WH1568> surely<WH389> they are<WH1961> vanity:<WH7723> they sacrifice<WH2076> bullocks<WH7794> in Gilgal;<WH1537> yea,<WH1571> their altars<WH4196> are as heaps<WH1530> in<WH5921> the furrows<WH8525> of the fields.<WH7704>
And Jacob<WH3290> fled<WH1272> into the country<WH7704> of Syria,<WH758> and Israel<WH3478> served<WH5647> for a wife,<WH802> and for a wife<WH802> he kept<WH8104> sheep.
And by a prophet<WH5030> the LORD<WH3068> brought<WH5927> <WH853> Israel<WH3478> out of Egypt,<WH4480> <WH4714> and by a prophet<WH5030> was he preserved.<WH8104>

Ephraim <WH669> provoked him to anger<WH3707> most bitterly:<WH8563> therefore shall he leave<WH5203> his blood<WH1818> upon<WH5921> him, and his reproach<WH2781> shall his Lord<WH113> return<WH7725> unto him.
